meanings.definition: Tachismes: a style of abstract painting popular in the 1950s characterized by spontaneous brushwork and nonrepresentational forms.
meanings.sent1: The art gallery featured a stunning exhibition of tachismes.
meanings.sent2: Art students studied tachismes to understand abstract painting techniques.
meanings.sent3: The tachismes on the canvas seemed to dance together in a colorful frenzy.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions flowed onto the paper like tachismes on a stormy sea.
meanings.sent5: The tachismes in the artwork created a vibrant and dynamic visual experience.

meanings.definition: Tachismes: a collection of artistic techniques used to create a sense of movement and energy in a painting.
meanings.sent1: The artist used various tachismes to infuse life into the painting.
meanings.sent2: Tachismes can add a dynamic element to an otherwise static artwork.
meanings.sent3: The tachismes seemed to playfully jump off the canvas.
meanings.sent4: Her use of tachismes transformed the painting into a whirlwind of colors.
meanings.sent5: The tachismes in the artwork gave it a sense of vitality and motion.
